title: Valentine prompt single-page UI with evasive “No” and “Good choice❤️” reveal

requirements.summary: Implement a single-page Valentine prompt asking “Will you be my Valentine?” with “Yes” and “No” options.
acceptanceCriteria: The page shows the question text “Will you be my Valentine?” in English.
Two buttons are visible and labeled exactly “Yes” and “No”.
The page has no additional primary flows beyond answering the Valentine prompt.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page React view that renders the prompt text and two prominent buttons labeled exactly “Yes” and “No”, with minimal local state to represent prompt vs reveal.

requirements.summary: Make the “No” button evasive on hover/pointer enter and on touch attempt so it cannot be clicked.
acceptanceCriteria: On pointer hover/enter, the “No” button relocates away from the pointer and remains within the visible viewport.
On touch devices (iPad Chrome), attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to move before a click/selection is registered.
It is not possible to successfully click the “No” button under normal use.

file_operations.description: Add evasive positioning logic for the “No” button: use a relative container and absolutely-position the “No” button, relocating it on pointerenter/pointermove as well as touchstart/pointerdown (with preventDefault where appropriate), ensuring the new position stays within the viewport/container bounds and does not allow a normal click to register.

requirements.summary: On “Yes” click, transition to a success/reveal state showing a meme image with “Good choice❤️”.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” reliably transitions the UI into a success/reveal state.
The reveal state displays a meme image that includes the text “Good choice❤️”.
After the reveal, the evasive “No” interaction is no longer shown/needed.

file_operations.description: Implement the “Yes” click handler to switch the UI into a reveal state that replaces the prompt/buttons with an image-based meme reveal (and removes/does not render the evasive “No” button interactions once revealed).

requirements.summary: Apply a romantic pink/white theme with a responsive, centered layout that works well on iPad Chrome portrait/landscape.
acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a cohesive pink/white romantic theme (background, typography, button styling).
UI elements remain readable and usable on iPad-sized viewports without horizontal scrolling.
The main content is centered and visually balanced in both portrait and landscape.

file_operations.description: Create global styling (Tailwind directives if applicable + base styles) to support a pink/white romantic theme (background gradients/soft tones, typography defaults) and ensure the app fills the viewport without horizontal scrolling.

Apply responsive layout and styling (e.g., centered container, readable type scale, accessible button sizes) optimized for iPad viewport sizes in both portrait and landscape, keeping the experience as a single focused page.

requirements.summary: Add the generated meme image as a static public asset and reference it directly from the frontend reveal state.
acceptanceCriteria: The meme image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated and is referenced by the frontend via a static path.
The image loads correctly in the reveal state without any backend calls.

file_operations.description: Add the required generated meme image asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1024x1024.png for static serving.
Wire the reveal state to render the static image from frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1024x1024.png using a public/static reference (no backend calls).
